main event: A single unidentified aerial object was observed at Kirkland Air Force Base in New Mexico on 27 June 1949, exhibiting unusual lighting behavior and disappearance behind an obstacle.
interesting points: The object's behavior included flaring up and showing a faint, fan-shaped trail as it slowed down, and growing brighter as its speed increased.
It was self-luminous with no sound or odor associated with it.
The object was slightly larger than the brightest visible star, with a color similar to a star but slightly more orange in appearance.
The sighting lasted approximately 2 minutes, during which the object traveled from west to east.
The observer was situated on the second floor of a barracks at the Air Force base, and the weather conditions were clear and dark.
